name: Man's Comfort and Knowledge of God
description: The only comfort of the believer in life and death, and the means by which we know God through creation and His Word.

name: Holy Scripture
description: The canonical books of Scripture as the authoritative, sufficient, and clear rule of faith and life.

name: God and the Holy Trinity
description: The one true God: His being, attributes, and the three distinct persons of the Trinity.

name: Creation and Providence
description: God's work of creating the world, and His ongoing preservation and government of all things.

name: The Fall and Original Sin
description: The fall of man into sin, the corruption of human nature, and the misery that follows.

name: Election and Predestination
description: God's eternal, unconditional election of a people to salvation in Christ, and the reprobation of those passed by.

name: Christ the Redeemer
description: The incarnation, person, natures, and saving work of the Lord Jesus Christ.

name: The Atonement
description: The death of Christ as a sufficient sacrifice for sin, and the definite redemption of the elect.

name: Regeneration and Conversion
description: The total corruption of man, and God's sovereign work of regeneration and effectual calling through the Spirit.

name: Justification by Faith
description: The free justification of sinners by grace alone through faith alone in the righteousness of Christ alone.

name: Sanctification and Good Works
description: The renewal of believers in the image of God and the necessity and nature of good works as fruits of faith.

name: Perseverance of the Saints
description: The certain preservation of true believers in the state of grace to final salvation.

name: The Church
description: The nature, marks, and government of the one holy catholic church.

name: Church Discipline
description: The office of the keys and the exercise of church discipline.

name: The Sacraments, Baptism, and the Lord's Supper
description: The sacraments as visible signs and seals of God's promises, and the right administration of Baptism and the Lord's Supper.

name: The Ten Commandments
description: The duties required and sins forbidden in each of the Ten Commandments, as the rule of grateful obedience.

name: Prayer and the Lord's Prayer
description: The duty of prayer as the chief part of thankfulness, and the six petitions of the Lord's Prayer.

name: The Civil Magistrate and the Last Judgment
description: The office of the civil magistrate and the final judgment at the last day.
